name: Looking for a High AB High AC Fighter Build
author: Squid0023

posts.author: Squid0023
posts.content:
Hello,


 I am looking a fighter based class lvl 20 build that has High AB and High AC  Pure Fighter Classes
Melee Preference:  Shield and Weapon (Bastard Sword would be awesome but if it sacrifices key components nevermind)
Wants: Improved Knockdown, Expertise

Restrictions:
Classes must be no more than 10 levels apart when multiclassing
All Prestige classes must have at least 5 levels in them
-No RDD

Preferences: Fighter/Rogue , Fighter Bard, 
The Highest Enchantment is like +3  Echantment

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
High AB + High AC = dexer.  Choose a finessable weapon. 

The only other way is an RDD 10 but then that's not pure fighter, is it?

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
HipRedux wrote:
High AB + High AC = dexer. 

 
A halfling dexer, if I might add...

You need dex 30 to surpass the AC from full plate. A maxed elf or halfling gets dex 24 (or 25). With max +12 dex from items and potions they get dex 36 (37) and end up with +4 AC compared to strength builds. Monks can get even better AC with their AC bonus from wis and +1 AC per 5 levels, but then they cannot use shields.

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
... quite, Mick.

Possibly kukri/large shield with stealth to take further advantage of the size modifier.  A halfling fighter/barb would be able to boost AB via successful taunts as well.  Rage would be detrimental to the AC but boost Fort, HP and damage, should the need arise.  And the minor DR wouldn't hurt either.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
Your assuming +12 DEX enhancements in a +3 environment. Is that a safe assumption?

If not, then how about a STR-based sword-and-board Fighter 14 / Bard or Rogue 6?

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
The OC is a +3 enhancement and capping DEX is easy even without Cat pots.  Problem is only half-orc has a racial bias for STR so unless you adopt that race, the AB will always lag behind either halfling or elf.  It's the DEX boost found on gloves that makes the biggest difference.  You'll seldom (if ever) find them with any higher than +2 STR whereas +5 DEX are fairly common.  This isn't an unarmed build so that's the most likely property to be used in that slot by a dexer.

Yes, it's a pretty safe assumption in a +3 environment.

posts.author: Squid0023
posts.content: Curious is there a Build Sheet or Software you guys use to configure a build or do you go straight into NWN and build it up?

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content: Have a look at the Rules and Tools sub-forum here, Squid. That'll give you the software mechanics. Speaking for myself, because I refuse to adapt to technology on principle (either that, or because my techie skills are crap), I sit down with plenty of paper and pencils (and some wet towels) and do it from scratch. This means I get some of the sums wrong sometimes, but that makes for some of the more interesting discussions, I think. And it's all possible because there is no one best build for any scenario - just one that suits you best.

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
Squid0023 wrote:
Curious is there a Build Sheet or Software you guys use to configure a build or do you go straight into NWN and build it up?
You can tell Stagmeister hasn't spent much time rubbing elbows with corporate types because they all carry their spreadsheets on an umbilical like a cell phone or IPad.  Without Excel or an equivalent, their board meetings would be pure chaos without all those viewgraphs and pivot tables to pick apart and nod about.  Nonetheless, he's quite right.  Try not to depend on the CBC to solve your design questions or act as a surrogate tutor.  It's more like a nifty calculator to increase ease and speed of character-building.  I already had 20+ years of PnP scribbling before the boon of CBC popped up so was thrilled about the time-saving it provided.

For a neophyte builder, it's far, far superior to hash out the particulars on paper so he/she understands clearly how all the aspects interact rather than relying on Kamiryn to do it for you.  Besides, occasionally the ECB vets will find errors or inconsistencies in the CBC and must wait for an update until the sheet is closer to perfection.  Just use Kail's outline to assure your build's format is readable and provides all the essentials (or just examine several of the latest complete builds posted).

There is a free cloud version of Excel available for those without MSOffice but I cannot attest to it's functionality.  From what I've examined, though, it will use all the algorithms built into Kamiryn's version just fine.  Still waiting for others to report on its effectiveness, though.  You could be the first!
